page.title: 20WILDLIFE
page.content: In the River Aire fish have adapted well to the polluted water which is now clearing.There are various fish like the bream,common perch,roach, sticklebacks and minnows. The town centre has increased its bird and animal life.There are now house martins and swifts nesting under gutterings and slates.You may also see kestrels hovering overhead.Pit closures have meant that the face of stacks have been grassed over again.It has increased the wildlife there.You may see hares,rabbits,kestrels, skylarks and rats. There is also a stream with frogs and small fish and some of the stack has been taken over by a farmer so his cows can graze on it.
